intro: Cynorkis sylvatica, commonly known as the forest cynorkis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and alternate along the stem, often with a slightly rough texture. Cynorkis sylvatica thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
